question: How many soldiers did Gideon have when he defeated the Midianites?
explanation: God reduced Gideon's army to just 300 men to show that victory came from the Lord, not human strength.

verses.kjv:
And the LORD said unto Gideon, By the three hundred men that lapped will I save you, and deliver the Midianites into thine hand: and let all the
other people go every man unto his place.

question: Who made the sun stand still during a battle?
explanation: Joshua commanded the sun to stand still over Gibeon so Israel could defeat their enemies.

verses.kjv:
And the sun stood still, and the moon stayed, until the people had avenged themselves upon their enemies.
Is not this written in the book of Jasher? So the sun stood still in the midst of heaven, and hasted not to go down about a whole day.

question: Which woman killed the Canaanite commander Sisera with a tent peg?
explanation: Jael gave Sisera shelter but killed him while he slept by driving a tent peg through his temple.

verses.kjv: Then Jael Heber’s wife took a nail of the tent, and took an hammer in her hand, and went softly unto him, and smote the nail into his temples, and fastened it into the ground: for he was fast asleep and weary. So he died.

question: What unusual weapons did Gideon's army use to defeat the Midianites?
explanation: Gideon's 300 men broke jars hiding torches and blew trumpets, causing the Midianites to flee in confusion.

verses.kjv:
And the three companies blew the trumpets, and brake the pitchers, and held the lamps in their left hands, and the trumpets in their right hands to blow
withal: and they cried, The sword of the LORD, and of Gideon.

question: Which nation did King Saul fail to completely destroy as commanded?
explanation: Saul was commanded to destroy the Amalekites completely but spared King Agag and the best livestock.

verses.kjv: Now go and smite Amalek, and utterly destroy all that they have, and spare them not; but slay both man and woman, infant and suckling, ox and sheep, camel and ass.

question: What was Samson's greatest feat of strength?
explanation: Samson pushed down the two central pillars of the temple, killing more Philistines in his death than in his life.

verses.kjv:
And Samson took hold of the two middle pillars upon which the house stood, and on which it was borne up, of the one with his right hand, and of the other with his left.
And Samson said, Let me die with the Philistines. And he bowed himself with
all his might; and the house fell upon the lords, and upon all the people that
were therein. So the dead which he slew at his death were more than
they which he slew in his life.

question: How many stones did David take from the stream to fight Goliath?
explanation: David chose five smooth stones from the stream and put them in his shepherd's bag.

verses.kjv:
And he took his staff in his hand, and chose him five smooth stones out of the brook, and put them in a shepherd’s bag which he had, even in a scrip; and his sling
was in his hand: and he drew near to the Philistine.

question: Who led Israel's army against Sisera?
explanation: Deborah summoned Barak and told him the Lord commanded him to lead the attack against Sisera.

verses.kjv:
And she sent and called Barak the son of Abinoam out of Kedesh-naphtali, and said unto him, Hath not the LORD God of Israel commanded,
saying,
 Go and draw toward mount Tabor, and take with thee ten thousand men of the children of Naphtali and of the children of Zebulun?

question: What sign did God give Gideon with a fleece?
choices: Dew on the fleece but not the ground, then the reverse
explanation: God made the fleece wet and the ground dry, then reversed it to confirm His will.

verses.kjv:
Behold, I will put a fleece of wool in the floor;
and if the dew be on the fleece only, and
it be dry upon all the earth
beside, then shall I know that thou wilt save Israel by mine hand, as thou hast said.
And it was so: for he rose up early on the morrow, and thrust the fleece together, and wringed the dew out of the fleece, a bowl full of water.
And Gideon said unto God, Let not thine anger be hot against me, and I will speak but this once: let me prove, I pray thee, but this once with the fleece; let it now be dry only upon the fleece, and upon all the ground let there be dew.
And God did so that night: for it was dry upon the fleece only, and there was dew on all the ground.

question: What city did Abraham rescue Lot from?
explanation: Abraham recovered all the goods and brought back his relative Lot and his possessions.

verses.kjv: And he brought back all the goods, and also brought again his brother Lot, and his goods, and the women also, and the people.

question: Who fought against Israel at Rephidim?
explanation: The Amalekites came and attacked the Israelites at Rephidim.

verses.kjv: Then came Amalek, and fought with Israel in Rephidim.

question: What did the Israelites carry around Jericho?
explanation: Seven priests carrying seven trumpets went forward, marching before the ark of the Lord.

verses.kjv: And Joshua the son of Nun called the priests, and said unto them, Take up the ark of the covenant, and let seven priests bear seven trumpets of rams’ horns before the ark of the LORD.

question: Who killed Absalom?
explanation: Joab took three javelins and plunged them into Absalom's heart while he was still alive in the oak tree.

verses.kjv:
Then said Joab, I may not tarry thus with thee. And he took three darts in his hand, and thrust them through the heart of Absalom, while he
was yet alive in the midst of the oak.

question: How many men did Gideon have when he defeated the Midianites?
explanation: The Lord said to Gideon, 'With the three hundred men that lapped I will save you.'

verses.kjv:
And the LORD said unto Gideon, By the three hundred men that lapped will I save you, and deliver the Midianites into thine hand: and let all the
other people go every man unto his place.

question: What did the Israelites shout to make the walls of Jericho fall?
explanation: When the trumpets sounded, the army shouted, and at the sound of the trumpet, when the men gave a loud shout, the wall collapsed.

verses.kjv:
So the people shouted when
the priests blew with the trumpets: and it came to pass, when the people heard the sound of the trumpet, and the people shouted with a great shout, that the wall fell down flat, so that the people went up into the city, every man straight before him, and they took the city.

question: Which battle was stopped when Joshua commanded the sun to stand still?
explanation: Joshua commanded the sun to stand still over Gibeon so Israel could defeat their enemies.

verses.kjv: Then spake Joshua to the LORD in the day when the LORD delivered up the Amorites before the children of Israel, and he said in the sight of Israel, Sun, stand thou still upon Gibeon; and thou, Moon, in the valley of Ajalon.

question: How many stones did David take from the brook before fighting Goliath?
explanation: David chose five smooth stones from the stream and put them in his shepherd's bag.

verses.kjv:
And he took his staff in his hand, and chose him five smooth stones out of the brook, and put them in a shepherd’s bag which he had, even in a scrip; and his sling
was in his hand: and he drew near to the Philistine.

question: Which city's defeat was caused by Achan's sin of taking forbidden plunder?
explanation: Israel was defeated at Ai because Achan had taken devoted things from Jericho.

verses.kjv: But the children of Israel committed a trespass in the accursed thing: for Achan, the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, took of the accursed thing: and the anger of the LORD was kindled against the children of Israel.

question: What did the Israelites shout when the walls of Jericho fell?
explanation: When the trumpets sounded, the army shouted, and at the sound the wall collapsed.

verses.kjv:
So the people shouted when
the priests blew with the trumpets: and it came to pass, when the people heard the sound of the trumpet, and the people shouted with a great shout, that the wall fell down flat, so that the people went up into the city, every man straight before him, and they took the city.

question: Which nation attacked Israel from behind while they traveled through the wilderness?
explanation: The Amalekites met you on your journey and attacked all who were lagging behind.

verses.kjv:
How he met thee by the way, and smote the hindmost of thee,
even
 all
that were feeble behind thee, when thou
wast
 faint and weary; and he feared not God.

question: How tall was Goliath?
explanation: A champion named Goliath came out from the Philistine camp. His height was six cubits and a span (over 9 feet).

verses.kjv:
And there went out a champion out of the camp of the Philistines, named Goliath, of Gath, whose height
was six cubits and a span.

question: What did the Israelites take from Jericho that caused their defeat at Ai?
explanation: The Israelites were unfaithful regarding the devoted things; Achan took some of them.

verses.kjv: But the children of Israel committed a trespass in the accursed thing: for Achan, the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, took of the accursed thing: and the anger of the LORD was kindled against the children of Israel.

question: Who killed Sisera with a tent peg?
explanation: But Jael, Heber's wife, picked up a tent peg and a hammer and went quietly to him. She drove the peg through his temple.

verses.kjv: Then Jael Heber’s wife took a nail of the tent, and took an hammer in her hand, and went softly unto him, and smote the nail into his temples, and fastened it into the ground: for he was fast asleep and weary. So he died.

question: What miracle occurred during the battle at Gibeon?
explanation: The sun stopped in the middle of the sky and delayed going down about a full day.

verses.kjv:
And the sun stood still, and the moon stayed, until the people had avenged themselves upon their enemies.
Is not this written in the book of Jasher? So the sun stood still in the midst of heaven, and hasted not to go down about a whole day.

question: Which judge tore down his father's altar to Baal?
explanation: So Gideon took ten of his servants and did as the Lord told him. But because he was afraid, he did it at night.

verses.kjv:
Then Gideon took ten men of his servants, and did as the LORD had said unto him: and
so it was, because he feared his father’s household, and the men of the city, that he could not do
it by day, that he did
it by night.

question: What did David take from Goliath after killing him?
explanation: David ran and stood over him. He took hold of the Philistine's sword and drew it from the sheath. After he killed him, he cut off his head with the sword.

verses.kjv: Therefore David ran, and stood upon the Philistine, and took his sword, and drew it out of the sheath thereof, and slew him, and cut off his head therewith. And when the Philistines saw their champion was dead, they fled.

question: What did Gideon's men carry into battle?
explanation: He gave them trumpets and empty jars, with torches inside.

verses.kjv:
And he divided the three hundred men
into three companies, and he put a trumpet in every man’s hand, with empty pitchers, and lamps within the pitchers.

question: What fell from heaven during the battle at Gibeon?
explanation: As they fled before Israel, the Lord hurled large hailstones down on them, and more of them died from the hail than were killed by the swords of the Israelites.

verses.kjv:
And it came to pass, as they fled from before Israel,
and
 were in the going down to Beth-horon, that the LORD cast down great stones from heaven upon them unto Azekah, and they died:
they were
 more which died with hailstones than they whom the children of Israel slew with the sword.

question: Which judge defeated the Midianites with only 300 men?
explanation: The Lord said to Gideon, 'With the three hundred men that lapped I will save you and give the Midianites into your hands.'

verses.kjv:
And the LORD said unto Gideon, By the three hundred men that lapped will I save you, and deliver the Midianites into thine hand: and let all the
other people go every man unto his place.

question: At the battle of Gibeon, what did Joshua say should stand still (Joshua 10:12)?
explanation: Joshua 10:12 records Joshua’s words for the sun to stand still upon Gibeon and the moon in the valley of Ajalon.

verses.kjv: Then spake Joshua to the LORD in the day when the LORD delivered up the Amorites before the children of Israel, and he said in the sight of Israel, Sun, stand thou still upon Gibeon; and thou, Moon, in the valley of Ajalon.

question: During the battle at Gibeon, what did the LORD cast down from heaven upon the enemies (Joshua 10:11)?
explanation: Joshua 10:11 says the LORD cast down great stones from heaven and more died from the hailstones than from Israel’s sword.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as they fled from before Israel, and were in the going down to Beth-horon, that the LORD cast down great stones from heaven upon them unto Azekah, and they died: they were more which died with hailstones than they whom the children of Israel slew with the sword.

question: When the LORD told Gideon he still had too many men, where did he bring them to test them with water (Judges 7:4)?
explanation: Judges 7:4 says the LORD told Gideon to bring the people down unto the water for a test.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Gideon, The people are yet too many; bring them down unto the water, and I will try them for thee there: and it shall be, that of whom I say unto thee, This shall go with thee, the same shall go with thee; and of whomsoever I say unto thee, This shall not go with thee, the same shall not go.

question: In Gideon’s battle, what did the men have in their right hands (Judges 7:20)?
explanation: Judges 7:20 says they held the lamps in their left hands and the trumpets in their right hands to blow withal.

verses.kjv: And the three companies blew the trumpets, and brake the pitchers, and held the lamps in their left hands, and the trumpets in their right hands to blow withal: and they cried, The sword of the LORD, and of Gideon.

question: After Israel was smitten at Ai, how did Joshua and the elders show mourning before the ark (Joshua 7:6)?
choices: They rent their clothes and put dust upon their heads
They shaved their heads and fasted seven days
They sat in sackcloth by the altar
They went to the river and wept
explanation: Joshua 7:6 says Joshua and the elders rent their clothes and put dust upon their heads before the ark.

verses.kjv: And Joshua rent his clothes, and fell to the earth upon his face before the ark of the LORD until the eventide, he and the elders of Israel, and put dust upon their heads.

question: What did Achan say he saw among the spoils, leading him to take forbidden things (Joshua 7:21)?
explanation: Joshua 7:21 records Achan confessing he saw a goodly Babylonish garment among the spoils and took it.

verses.kjv: When I saw among the spoils a goodly Babylonish garment, and two hundred shekels of silver, and a wedge of gold of fifty shekels weight, then I coveted them, and took them; and, behold, they are hid in the earth in the midst of my tent, and the silver under it.

question: When Israel was commanded to go up against Amalek, what did Samuel tell Saul he would do (1 Samuel 15:1)?
choices: Hearken to the voice of the words of the LORD
explanation: 1 Samuel 15:1 says Samuel told Saul to hearken unto the voice of the words of the LORD.

verses.kjv: Samuel also said unto Saul, The LORD sent me to anoint thee to be king over his people, over Israel: now therefore hearken thou unto the voice of the words of the LORD.

question: In the battle described in 1 Samuel 17, what was Goliath’s height given in the KJV (1 Samuel 17:4)?
explanation: 1 Samuel 17:4 gives Goliath’s height as six cubits and a span.

verses.kjv: And there went out a champion out of the camp of the Philistines, named Goliath, of Gath, whose height was six cubits and a span.

question: In the battle against Sisera, where did Barak gather ten thousand men by Naphtali and Zebulun (Judges 4:10)?
explanation: Judges 4:10 says Barak went up to mount Tabor with ten thousand men of Naphtali and Zebulun.

verses.kjv: And Barak called Zebulun and Naphtali to Kedesh; and he went up with ten thousand men at his feet: and Deborah went up with him.

question: When Israel fought the Philistines at Mizpeh, what did Samuel offer as a burnt offering (1 Samuel 7:9)?
explanation: 1 Samuel 7:9 says Samuel took a sucking lamb and offered it for a burnt offering wholly unto the LORD.

verses.kjv: And Samuel took a sucking lamb, and offered it for a burnt offering wholly unto the LORD: and Samuel cried unto the LORD for Israel; and the LORD heard him.

question: In the same battle at Mizpeh, what did the LORD do to the Philistines (1 Samuel 7:10)?
choices: Thundered with a great thunder and discomfited them
Opened the ground to swallow them
explanation: 1 Samuel 7:10 says the LORD thundered with a great thunder and discomfited the Philistines.

verses.kjv: And as Samuel was offering up the burnt offering, the Philistines drew near to battle against Israel: but the LORD thundered with a great thunder on that day upon the Philistines, and discomfited them; and they were smitten before Israel.

question: When king Asa cried unto the LORD against the Ethiopians, what did he call God regarding power (2 Chronicles 14:11)?
choices: There is none beside thee to help, between the mighty and him that hath no power
The God of the harvest and the rain
The God who only helps the strong
The God who blesses only kings
explanation: 2 Chronicles 14:11 says Asa prayed that the LORD helps between the mighty and those without power.

verses.kjv: And Asa cried unto the LORD his God, and said, LORD, it is nothing with thee to help, whether with many, or with them that have no power: help us, O LORD our God; for we rest on thee, and in thy name we go against this multitude. O LORD, thou art our God; let not man prevail against thee.

question: In Asa’s battle, what did the LORD do to the Ethiopians before Asa and before Judah (2 Chronicles 14:12)?
choices: Caused Judah to flee in fear
explanation: 2 Chronicles 14:12 says the LORD smote the Ethiopians before Asa and before Judah.

verses.kjv: So the LORD smote the Ethiopians before Asa, and before Judah; and the Ethiopians fled.

question: When David sought to bring up the ark, where did he gather all Israel (2 Samuel 6:1)?
choices: Thirty thousand chosen men of Israel
explanation: 2 Samuel 6:1 says David gathered together all the chosen men of Israel, thirty thousand.

verses.kjv: Again, David gathered together all the chosen men of Israel, thirty thousand.

question: When the men of Israel returned from smiting the Philistines, what did they do (2 Samuel 8:1)?
choices: David took Methegammah out of the hand of the Philistines
They built a temple in Gath
They made peace with the Amalekites
explanation: 2 Samuel 8:1 says David took Methegammah out of the hand of the Philistines.

verses.kjv: And after this it came to pass, that David smote the Philistines, and subdued them: and David took Methegammah out of the hand of the Philistines.

question: When the king of Syria helped the children of Ammon, how many chariots did they hire out of Mesopotamia according to the KJV (1 Chronicles 19:6)?
explanation: 1 Chronicles 19:6 mentions the children of Ammon hired thirty and two thousand chariots, and a king with his people.

verses.kjv: And when the children of Ammon saw that they had made themselves odious to David, Hanun and the children of Ammon sent a thousand talents of silver to hire them chariots and horsemen out of Mesopotamia, and out of Syria-maachah, and out of Zobah.

question: Before David fought the Syrians, what did he tell Israel to do if the Syrians were too strong for him (2 Samuel 10:11)?
explanation: 2 Samuel 10:11 says Joab told Abishai that if the Syrians were too strong, Abishai should help him.

verses.kjv: And he said, If the Syrians be too strong for me, then thou shalt help me: but if the children of Ammon be too strong for thee, then I will come and help thee.

question: What did the people say after Jephthah defeated the children of Ammon (Judges 11:35)?
choices: Blessed be the LORD our God!
Let us return unto Gilead in peace!
explanation: Judges 11:35 records Jephthah’s words when his daughter came out to meet him after the victory.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when he saw her, that he rent his clothes, and said, Alas, my daughter! thou hast brought me very low, and thou art one of them that trouble me: for I have opened my mouth unto the LORD, and I cannot go back.

question: When Saul commanded the people to wait in Gilgal, how long did Saul tarry according to Samuel’s set time (1 Samuel 13:8)?
explanation: 1 Samuel 13:8 says Saul waited seven days according to the set time Samuel had appointed.

verses.kjv: And he tarried seven days, according to the set time that Samuel had appointed: but Samuel came not to Gilgal; and the people were scattered from him.

question: When an Amalekite claimed he had killed Saul, what did David command, and why (2 Samuel 1:15-16)?
choices: He commanded a young man to fall upon him, because he said, 'I have slain the LORD'S anointed'
He set him free, because he brought news of victory
He put him in prison, because he was a Philistine
He made him captain, because he had fought bravely
explanation: 2 Samuel 1:15-16 says David ordered a young man to kill the Amalekite because he testified against himself that he had slain the LORD'S anointed.

verses.kjv: And David called one of the young men, and said, Go near, and fall upon him. And he smote him that he died. And David said unto him, Thy blood be upon thy head; for thy mouth hath testified against thee, saying, I have slain the LORD'S anointed.

question: When David fought against Hadadezer, what did David do to the horses of the chariots (2 Samuel 8:4)?
choices: He houghed all the chariot horses, but reserved of them for an hundred chariots
He set all the chariot horses free into the wilderness
He sold all the chariot horses to Egypt
He brought all the chariot horses into the tabernacle
explanation: 2 Samuel 8:4 says David houghed all the chariot horses and kept horses enough for a hundred chariots.

verses.kjv: And David took from him a thousand chariots, and seven hundred horsemen, and twenty thousand footmen: and David houghed all the chariot horses, but reserved of them for an hundred chariots.
